subject: RE: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
msgSnippet: ... sorry, i didn t read the whole e-mail: since you have your .java and .class files in junit samples directory add junit samples in your
messageBody:
> When i am running TestHelloClass as
> junit.samples.TestHelloClass then it
> is displaying the error as Class not found
> "junit.samples.TestHelloClass"

sorry, i didn't read the whole e-mail:
since you have your .java and .class files in junit\samples directory
add <initial path>\junit\samples in your classpath,
where <initial path> is the path leading up to the junit directory.
regards,
Nilesh
